Often, thepercentage exceedance time isinterpreted asaprobability andthestatistical exceedance curve istaken tobecumulative probability distribution function. Because of thegeneral periodicity ofmeteorological phenomena, cumulative statistics covering several full years, orlike periods ofseveral successive years, are themost directly useful. (Atechnique exists, however, forextending statistics.to apply toperiods greater than those actually covered. This is described inSection 6.3.4.) Statistics covering single years orperiods would beexpected toexhibit large fluctuations from year toyear, because ofthe great variability oftheweather.
